results.firPara: Gary Lineker is right. There seems no point even appealing against a red card any more because unless you have evidence to prove mistaken identity or something similar the Football Associations independent regulatory commission is simply going to back the referees decision.
results.secPara: Utterly pointless, Lineker tweeted after Leicesters Jamie Vardy was told he must serve a three-match ban. Going into the appeal, the striker appeared to have a strong case. The tackle on Stokes Mame Biram Diouf was not especially bone-jarring and the ball was clearly won first. That no longer matters if the challenge itself is out of control and dangerous – touching leather before flesh is rightly no longer allowed to legitimise a reckless follow-through into an opponent – though none of that applied to the incident at the Bet365 Stadium.
results.webTitle: Leicester’s loss of Vardy highlights inflexibility of FA’s appeals procedure | Paul Wilson

results.firPara: The Italian striker symbolised Chelseas transformation in the 1990s, and his stunning solo goal in his sixth match for the club served notice of his talent to an English game still emerging from its earlier parochialism
results.secPara: The Italian striker symbolised Chelseas transformation in the 1990s, and his stunning solo goal in his sixth match for the club served notice of his talent to an English game still emerging from its earlier parochialism
results.webTitle: Golden Goal: Gianfranco Zola for Chelsea v West Ham (1996) | Jacob Steinberg

results.firPara: • Schubert had been in position for just over 12 months
results.secPara: Borussia Mönchengladbach have sacked their coach André Schubert hours after being beaten at home by their fellow Bundesliga strugglers Wolfsburg.
results.webTitle: Borussia Mönchengladbach sack coach André Schubert after Wolfsburg defeat

results.firPara: A manager given the boot on Christmas Day; a stadium that doubled up as an ice-skating rink and a 66-goal Boxing Day bonanza. Send your Christmas questions and answers to knowledge@theguardian.com and follow us on Twitter
results.secPara: Has any club ever been cruel enough to give their manager the boot on Christmas Day? wondered Simon Briggs in 2006.
results.webTitle: The Knowledge archive Christmas Special: given the sack on 25 December?

results.firPara: Cursed as they are with strikers currently struggling to hit a cows backside with a banjo, West Ham are in the market for some goal-getters, and the Daily Telegraph describes their plan to lure either Anthony Martial or Marcus Rashford to the London Stadium on loan from Manchester United as ambitious.
results.secPara: The fact that neither player regularly features in Uniteds starting 11 appears to have tempted West Ham to chance their arm. The Chelsea striker Michy Batshuayi, Sassuolos Grégoire Defrel and Portos Laurent Depoitre are also cited as being on the Hammers radar, in a state of affairs that suggests somebody in their scouting department is just throwing darts at Panini stickers on a wall in the office.
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Anthony Martial or Marcus Rashford to West Ham?

results.firPara: • Manager keen to stay at Old Trafford beyond current deal
results.secPara: Manchester United are open to José Mourinho extending his stay as manager beyond the three-year contract he signed in the summer. The club are delighted with the start the side have made and believe he is the man to bring a 21st league title to Old Trafford.
results.webTitle: Manchester United consider offering Mourinho contract extension

results.firPara: Yaya Touré believes he is on a mission to make Manchester City bigger than Manchester United and hopes to remain at the Etihad Stadium until José Mourinho and the rest of the neighbours at Old Trafford have been fully eclipsed.
results.secPara: The 33-year-old midfielder becomes a free agent in the summer and Pep Guardiola concedes he is unsure whether Touré will remain part of his plans next season – but the Ivorian appears in no rush to leave. I came to this club to make history, said Touré, who after spending some time on the fringes of Guardiolas squad, is back on centre stage. I want this club to change, I want this club to be bigger than United. I know its going to be a lot of work but thats my dream.
results.webTitle: Yaya Touré: I want Manchester City to be bigger than Manchester United

results.firPara: There is no downside to winning a derby in the fourth minute of added time but for Sadio Mané the joy of Monday at Goodison Park will make it harder to leave Liverpool for the Africa Cup of Nations next month. He believes Jürgen Klopps team will improve and sustain the challenge to the league leaders Chelsea in his absence.
results.secPara: Mané secured his place in Liverpool affections with the late goal that defeated Everton in the 227th Merseyside derby and transformed a costly goalless draw into a crucial three points. His place in Klopps team will soon be vacated, however, when the Senegal international departs for the ACN in Gabon after Liverpools Premier League game at Sunderland on 2 January.
results.webTitle: Liverpool’s matchwinner Sadio Mané will head to Gabon with a heavy heart

results.firPara: Celtic extended their lead at the top of the Premiership to 14 points with victory over Partick Thistle, their 16th win in 17 league matches this season and their 12th in a row. But the convincing win expected given the teams respective league positions – Partick are bottom of the table with just three wins – did not materialise. Partick might have come away with something had they taken their chances.
results.secPara: Scott Sinclair scored the only goal in the 17th minute at Celtic Park, his 11th of the season. The former Chelsea and Manchester City forward was quickest on to Liam Hendersons low free-kick across the area and scooped a smart first-time effort past Tomas Cerny in the Partick goal.
results.webTitle: Scott Sinclair fires Celtic 14 points clear with winner against Partick Thistle

results.firPara: Clubs at opposite ends of League Two meet on Wednesday in an FA Cup replay with a prize of close to £500,000 in gate receipts and TV revenue for the winner
results.secPara: It is the game they are calling the half a million pound match. Well, they could do. For the winners of Wednesdays FA Cup second round replay between Newport County and Plymouth Argyle, the spoils are a third round tie at Liverpool. A share of gate receipts and TV revenue could mean either League Two side earning close to £500,000 as well as the chance of a footballing lifetime in facing Jürgen Klopps Premier League title contenders. Its no wonder some people are getting a little anxious at the prospect.
results.webTitle: Anfield trip offers huge bounty once Newport and Plymouth settle round two
